result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Brandon Daniel Brandt
Current: 901 10th St, Farmington, MN 55024 United States  (Effective: 05-25-2022)
Prior: 870 Kingsbury Lane #108, Le Sueur, MN 56058 United States
Per SIBS. bph

- AMENDED

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- Defendant shall be released to NorthStar employees who shall transport Defendant straight to treatment facility.  If Defendant absconds or discharges from NorthStar Treatment Center against staff advice, Defendant to report immediately to St. Croix County Jail.  If Defendant absconds or discharges against staff advise, NorthStar to provide information to the Court immediately.
Filed by ADA Becker. km

RE: treatment. Filed by Atty Perrin. km
Per SRN, I got the info and amended bond - hopefully the van is still here. js/km
Pre-trial conference on July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

08:27 AM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, ADA: Michael Joseph Becker, DF ATTY: Shirlene Renee Perrin, DF: Brandon Daniel Brandt appeared from jail. Set for PH, parties agree to have prelim and arraignment today.  S/T of Officer Timothy Rue of Hudson PD.  Direct by ADA Becker.  Court questions witness.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. State will file information which will mirror complaint.    Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG on all counts.  Atty Perrin would like to amend bond.  ADA Becker makes statement.  Atty Perrin to contact Northstar Treatment Center to see if a bed is available, if it is, Court is willing to amend bond but will not do so until confirmation is received from treatment center.  Bond continues. If DE is in treatment he can appear by zoom for next hearing, otherwise DE needs to appear in person.  Adjourned 8:46 AM.   Case recalled at 1:18 PM, ADA Becker appeared, DE and DE Atty did not appear and were not required to appear.  Court received information that employees from NorthStar are here and ready transport DE, bond amended, DE to report to North Star. Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Appointing Atty Perrin. km
Presigned by DE. arc
Per SRN. arc
Letter from ADA Becker re considerations when setting bond.  gll
Preliminary hearing on May 25, 2022 at 08:00 am.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: Liddle, ADA:   Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Travis Satorius   DF:  Brandon Daniel Brandt appeared from jail. DE qualifies for PD services. Has copy of complaint. Address updated. DOB correct. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. ADA Ellenwood gives bond argument. Recites a letter received from MN DOC Agent. Atty Satorius responds. Court will QUASH WARRANT.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:00 am.
